result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Yanke gives the court her sentencing recommendation. Attorney Jakobson makes a statement regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the court.
Final pre-trial on October 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:41 PM Defendant Chance J Two Crow appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Chance J Two Crow.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jakobson would be requesting a final pre trial date to have more time to come up with a resolution for all of the cases.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Chance J Two Crow appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared by phone for Chance J Two Crow.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This matter will be reset so the defendant can discuss with his attorney how he would like to proceed. Bond is continued.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

No contact with ASP, SMD or residence. Must provide legitimate address if it has changed.

8:49 AM Defendant Chance J Two Crow in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Chance J Two Crow.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews the case. Attorney Lambert requests to adjourn this matter due to witness dilemmas. Attorney Jakobson objects to adjournment. Attorney Lambert responds to Attorney Jakobson's argument. 
Court adjourns the trial and this matter will be reset. Bond is converted into a signature bond.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:12 PM Defendant Chance J Two Crow in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Chance J Two Crow.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not enter plea today.
This matter will continue with the Jury Trial. Bond is continued.
Plea hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Checklist - State
Order for Scheduling
State's Witness List
Demand for Discovery - Prosecutor
Order for Scheduling
Jury trial - 12 person on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Chance J Two Crow in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Chance J Two Crow.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court goes over the Request to Produce Writings Used to Refresh Memory. Attorney McGrath gives the report to Attorney Jakobson and Attorney Jakobson has reviewed it.

Officer Krier is still sworn under oath and testifies. Testifies to the defendants father stating he did not strike the defendant. Testifies to the defendant stating his father did strike him and a correctional officer finding a bump on the back of the defendants head. Testifies to the defendant chasing AJP into the home. Testifies to AJP's injuries. Testifies to SMD's injuries. Testifies to SMD indicating that she had injuries from a prior day with other females. Testifies to SMD and AJP stating that Chance hit them with a skillet. 
Attorney McGrath cross examines the witness. Testifies to the injuries that were seen could've been caused by a fist or skillet.
Attorney McGrath requests the court take Judicial Notice of a previous conviction and bonds that were currently in effect during this alleged crime. Court grants and takes Judicial Notice.
Attorney Jakobson makes an argument to the court regarding why we shouldn't rely on hear say statements.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Attorney Jakobson requests a speedy jury trial demand. - Court wants everything submitted to the court by 08/05/2022

This matter will be set for Trial and bond is continued. 08/22/2022 @9:00 in branch 2.

10:47 AM Defendant Chance J Two Crow in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Chance J Two Crow.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court goes over the Request to Produce Writings Used to Refresh Memory. Court grants that Attorney McGrath can give the report over to Attorney Jakobson. The parties have already exchanged the report and Attorney Jakobson has reviewed it.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Oral ruling on June 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Re: Brief
Brief regarding Compelling Production of Reports
Defendant's Letter Brief Re: Request to Produce Writings Used to Refresh Memory

3:50 PM Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared by phone for Chance J Two Crow.  Attorney Nathan Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court puts on record that he finds good cause to go outside the time limits to complete preliminary hearing. Attorney Jakobson and Attorney McGrath each have one day to file a brief.

10:01 AM Defendant Chance J Two Crow in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Chance J Two Crow.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Lucas Krier is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney McGrath. He is a police officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 5/31/22, he was dispatched to a residence where there was a physical disturbance. When he arrived there was someone walking away. He identified the person walking away as the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. The defendant stated he left the residence because he was struck on the head with a frying pan. He later observed a bump on his head. He went to the residence and a man, AJP, was being treated by EMS for a cut on his head and in his mouth. He stated defendant inflicted those injuries on him.  He spoke to SMD and she stated that the two individuals were fighting and she tried to deescalate the situation and defendant hit her. She stated she and the defendant were in a relationship and lived together.  Attorney Jakobson cross-examines witness.  
Court adjourns hearing as Attorney Jakobson will be providing letter brief why he should be allowed to have police report during preliminary hearing. He should provide it within one day. Attorney McGrath will provide response in one day.
Letter from defendant requesting a bond modification
